cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn north across the Yucatan Channel on Monday, then accelerate north-north-eastward across the east-central Gulf toward the Florida Panhandle mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Cabo Catoche, Mexico (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Isle of Youth (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the Florida Big Bend and Panhandle
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (track well west of Tampa Bay limits surge to <3 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (8%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts late Tuesday into Wednesday; otherwise breezy conditions
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above nuisance levels in Tampa Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 1–3 inches Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional squalls may reduce visibility and temporarily halt cargo-handling operations
